metadata.title: CVE-2024-36890 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mm/slab: make __free(kfree) accept error pointersCurrently, if an automatically freed allocation is an error pointer thatwill lead to a crash.  An example of this is in wm831x_gpio_dbg_show().   171	char *label __free(kfree) = gpiochip_dup_line_label(chip, i);   172	if (IS_ERR(label)) {   173		dev_err(wm831x->dev, "Failed to duplicate label\n");   174		continue;   175  }The auto clean up function should check for error pointers as well,otherwise we're going to keep hitting issues like this.

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
